Context:
The Automation Technician program offered by the college covers topics in digital electronics, process control, SCADA systems, programming of PLCs, robotics, automated manufacturing systems, hydraulics and pneumatics, programming languages, and alarm management. The learning materials are provided as web-based downloadable files in 18 interactive modules using text, 2D and 3D animations, photos, audio clips, and lab simulations. Interactive exercises, practice exams, and online support are included for computer-based final exam preparation. The program integrates theory with lab projects using LogixSim software which includes 2D and 3D simulation products and allows for design, testing, and debugging of control devices and automated equipment.

Minimum computer requirements for the program include: Intel Core i3, i5, i7 or AMD Ryzen 3, 5, 7 equivalent processor, 4GB RAM, 500 MB of available disk space, Windows 7/8/8.1/10/11 operating system, and internet access with an email account.

Upon completion of the program, career opportunities include designing, installing, and maintaining equipment in industrial automation and control. Possible systems worked on include simple fuses, motor drives, PLCs, solid-state devices, and robotics. There are no specified educational pathways mentioned after completing the certificate program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Automation Technician Program (Distance Education) T950 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The Automation Technician Certificate program offered at the college provides students with the opportunity to continue their studies and pursue a Certificate in Electromechanics, PLCs, or Robotics. The required courses for the Automation Technician Certificate program include "Introduction to Robotics" (ELNC 9111) and "Robot Programming" (ELNC 9113). The tuition for domestic students is $1,780.00*, with an initial registration fee of $560 that includes all learning materials and laboratory simulation software. International students are charged the same fees but in U.S. dollars. There is no financial assistance information provided in the text.

*Note: The tuition fee listed is for the program starting in Fall 2023, and fees may be subject to change for future programs.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Automation Technician Program (Distance Education) T950 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
Program Fees: The fees for the Automation Technician program are subject to change for the program starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates. (No specific fee information is provided.)

Financial Assistance: This program is not eligible for OSAP funding.

Admission Requirements:
- Students must have a high school diploma with credits at or above the general level or equivalent mature student status to enter the Automation Technician program.
- Mature students who are 19 years or older and do not have a high school diploma can enroll.

Special Requirements for International Students:
- The online distance program is only available for international students to study while remaining in their home country.
- This program does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada.

How to Apply:
- Prospective students can call 416-415-4726 or visit automationprogram.com for application information.

Contact Information:
- International Students can contact George Brown College at 416-415-4726 or toll-free at 1-888-553-5333.
- The email address for inquiries is info@gbctechtraining.com.

Related Programs:
- Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146)
- Mechanical Engineering Technology – Design (T121)
- Electromechanical Engineering Technology – Building Automation (T171)

Additional Information:
- The information contained on the website is subject to change without notice.
- Prospective students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
